pclasses.name: :active
pclasses.description: in the middle of a click, when a mouse is being held down

pclasses.name: :checked
pclasses.description: for input/radio buttons when selected

pclasses.name: :default
pclasses.description: selects default element in a group of similar elements

pclasses.name: :disabled
pclasses.description: any elements that have been disabled

pclasses.name: :empty
pclasses.description: selects items that have no children

pclasses.name: :enabled
pclasses.description: items that are not disabled

pclasses.name: :first
pclasses.description: styling of a first page while printing

pclasses.name: :first-child
pclasses.description: any element that is the first child of its parent

pclasses.name: :first-of-type
pclasses.description: selects first element of a certain type in a list of children

pclasses.name: :focus
pclasses.description: element that has gained focused

pclasses.name: :hover
pclasses.description: element being hovered over

pclasses.name: :indeterminate
pclasses.description: checkbox whos state is indeterminate

pclasses.name: :in-range
pclasses.description: if element has a min and max, element is selected if it is within the specified range

pclasses.name: :invalid
pclasses.description: form element that fails to validate

pclasses.name: :lang(<language-code>)
pclasses.description: matches elements based on their specified language

pclasses.name: :last-child
pclasses.description: matches last child in a series of child elements

pclasses.name: :last-of-type
pclasses.description: last sibling of a given type of element

pclasses.name: :left
pclasses.description: describes left page when the document is printed

pclasses.name: :link
pclasses.description: links inside elements that haven't been visited

pclasses.name: :not(<selector>)
pclasses.description: the negation pseudo class

pclasses.name: :nth-child(an+b)
pclasses.description: value can also be 'even' or 'odd'. a/b must be integers

pclasses.name: :nth-last-child(an+b)
pclasses.description: essentially nth-child but going backwards

pclasses.name: :nth-last-of-type(an+b)
pclasses.description: 2 would be second to last element of a given type

pclasses.name: :only-child
pclasses.description: elements that are the only child of its parent, aka no siblings

pclasses.name: only-of-type
pclasses.description: represents any element that has no siblings of the given type

pclasses.name: :optional
pclasses.description: input tag that isn't set to required

pclasses.name: :out-of-range
pclasses.description: if min and max are specified, element is selected when not within those bounds

pclasses.name: :read-only
pclasses.description: element is not writable by user

pclasses.name: :read-write
pclasses.description: editable by user

pclasses.name: :required
pclasses.description: input tag that has required attribute set

pclasses.name: :right
pclasses.description: right page for printable material

pclasses.name: :root
pclasses.description: root element of a tree

pclasses.name: :target
pclasses.description: element representing the current hash location of uri

pclasses.name: :valid
pclasses.description: input or form whos content validates

pclasses.name: :visited
pclasses.description: links that have been visited
